hero.title: Bring Great Points Together with PointLab
hero.subtitle:
In the age of information overload, noise wins.
Sharp, well-earned points shouldn’t be buried.
PointLab exists to collect great points.
Share them, surface them, debate them, vote on them, let them settle.
In the end, we get a handpicked list of the sharpest insights.

guide.title: Writing Tips
guide.subtitle: How to craft a sharp point

card1.title: Distill your point into one sentence
card1.body:
If it takes three minutes to explain a concept clearly, can it be shorter?
If it takes one minute, can you say it in one sentence?
We need a sharper framing — a condensed headline that sticks.

If you could only say one sentence, what would it be?
Attention is scarce. Great points start from one sentence!

card2.title: A point needs supporting heat
card2.body:
A tea bag alone tastes bitter — it needs hot water.
Once you have the key sentence, add evidence: reasoning, data, stories, analogies, quotes — that’s your flavor.

card3.title: Feed one bite at a time
card3.body:
No one watches a 10-hour movie, but split into episodes and people binge.
Communication works the same.
Serve one bite at a time — if it’s too much, split it into multiple points.
